article.headline: Boston U. 53, New Hampshire 29
article.story: BOSTON (AP) -- Corey Lowe had 13 points and seven rebounds to lead Boston University to a 53-29 victory over the University of New Hampshire on Saturday. Carlos Strong scored 10 points and added six rebounds. Omari Peterkin posted his second straight game with 12 rebounds for BU (6-10, 3-1 America East). Blagoj Janev and Jermaine Anderson each scored five points to pace the Wildcats (5-12, 2-3) The Terriers never trailed, and the score was tied only once, 2-2, after a jumper by the Wildcats' Tyrece Gibbs at 17:28 in the first half. BU had a 19-point halftime lead, 32-13, and extended that to its largest advantage of the afternoon, 39-13, at 14:57 in the second half as the Wildcats started the frame on a 5:31 scoring drought. The Terriers won the battle of the boards by a 46-28 margin. UNH shot just 21.3 percent from the floor. New Hampshire's 29 points was the fewest scored since the team was defeated 14 years ago at Providence 66-27.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
